detailsOfAchievement: Background: Krida Evam Yuva Samiti (KEYS), is Pithoragarh based organization registered under societies registration act 21, 1860 bearing registration no 178/2002-03. The organization is working in the rural and urban areas of Pithoragarh district for last many years. One of the major objectives of the organization is working towards the rural women and especially the youths and trains them on income generation activities for making them self sustain. Few of the activities of the organization carried include Education, Health, Nutrition, Road Safety Awareness, Consumer Awareness and Income generation programmes. Major focus of the organization is on SC/ST and economically backward classes of the society. Currently the organization has focused on awareness generation programmes which apart from the above list also include computer education for the minority people, environmental awareness programmes and various development activities for the people of the area. The organization has well trained professionals having vast experience or rural development activities and is equipped with versatile expertise. The organization worked with NABARD under the SHGs formation programme and made 20 groups mostly consists of women. Each group having about 8 members all having women representation. These groups were formed in Sanghar, Bans, Jajurali, Baste and Kalshin Katia villages of Bin block of Pitthoragarh. The present proposal would help in providing them with an alternative and innovative training and help in increasing their social status.

title: LOK PRABANDH VIKAS SANSTHA
detailsOfAchievement: LBVS is working on holistic development of villagers in Takula block of Almora district with child and human rights as its central focus towards the same the organization is working through educational interventionThe organization conducts programs towards awareness and capacity building of Panchyat representatives Van Panchayat Sarpanchs community organizations feeding mothers and ASHA workers Activities around natural resources management and income generation are being undertaken Constant efforts are being made to fight basic probems of birth registration immunization education livelihood and malnutrition We are engaging children and youth collectives through creative activities to uncover their hidden talents Information regarding various central and state schemes for benefits of citizens is being provided to the community along with legal literacy From time to time we also conduct health camps Due to the efforts of the organization the region has seen many positive developments Hundreds of eligible senior citizens widows and disables have been able to access due pensions there has been a reduction in the level of school From the health perspective there has been an increase in the immunization level and institutional childbirth in the region Timber rights were finally availed to the villagers affected by Binsar Wildlife Sanctuary after FIFTEEN years of struggle Thousands of trees were saved from illegal logging in Sunoli Women collectives have been formed to successfully fight forest fires and the efforts of such a collective in Dotiyalganva have been rewarded by the Divisional forest officer of the region Through Forest Department agricultural land in Risaal village was fenced to protect it from wild animals. Around NINETY FIVE PERCENTAGE of land in the region lies barren and efforts are being made to reforest them with the help of villagers The organization has played an important role in bringing out notifications regarding compensations for crop damage and injury to villagers by wild boars and increase in compensations for loss of cattle by leopards

detailsOfAchievement: SBMA is Committed to a human development approach, SBMA facilitates empowerment of children and women by developing their own capabilities and strengthening their institutions. The underlying principles of SBMA in all its programs are Nurturing community based groups, Developing their capacities for addressing the developmental issues and managing them, Enabling access to services provided by state and private agencies, Creating services where others are not forthcoming, Aggregating community based groups and facilitating them to emerge as community based organization for continuing the interventions initiated by SBMA. SBMA focuses its intervention on Education, Health, Community Governance, Livelihood Promotion, Natural Resource Management & Child Right & Child Protection. In each of the thematic areas SBMA is involved in Capacity building, Advocacy and Networking, Field Implementation & Based Organizations. All programs are catalyzing holistic development of the communities through interventions in Education, livelihood, Health,Water & Sanitation, Disaster Management, Child & Mother Health etc. 40800 in Chmoli and Uttarkashi children derived benefit from de worming campaigning, 14601 persons treated for various ailments through Multi Specialty Health Camps, 1341 pregnant women have received tetanus toxide vaccinations, 592 mothers received Ante Natal Care and Pre Natal Care26 disabled children were recommended for certification,Total 4232 boys and girls in 180 villages examined for nutritional deficiency, 2500 children covered for Hepatitis B vaccine,Approx 500 patients examined and counseled through four specialized camps of RTI&STI.
